material.mattext: It is known that human pregnancy in the general population is 268 days. Do the results of the study provide evidence (with 95% confidence) that the mean pregnancy length of women who smoke during pregnancy is lower than that of the general population? Explain.

Yes. We are 95% confident that μ is between (257 , 263). Since all of this interval (i.e., all the plausible values for μ) is below 268, we can say with 95% confidence that the mean pregnancy length of women who smoke during pregnancy is lower than that of the general population (which is 268). Click here to see a figure which explains this point.
